verses.name: Proverbs 18:1
verses.text: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:2
verses.text: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:3
verses.text: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:4
verses.text: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:5
verses.text: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:6
verses.text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:7
verses.text: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:8
verses.text: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:9
verses.text: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:10
verses.text: The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:11
verses.text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:12
verses.text: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:13
verses.text: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:14
verses.text: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?

verses.name: Proverbs 18:15
verses.text: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:16
verses.text: A man’s gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:17
verses.text: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:18
verses.text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:19
verses.text: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:20
verses.text: A man’s belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:21
verses.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:22
verses.text: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the Lord.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:23
verses.text: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

verses.name: Proverbs 18:24
verses.text: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
